ranked_diseases.explanation: Plexiform neurofibromas are pathognomonic for NF1 and occur in 25-30% of patients. All reference cases with plexiform neurofibroma were diagnosed with NF1. This is the most likely diagnosis despite having only one documented feature.
Also known as schwannomatosis, can rarely present with plexiform neurofibromas, though typically presents with schwannomas. Less common than NF1 but should be considered.
A localized form of NF1 that can present with plexiform neurofibromas limited to one body segment. Possible if the neurofibroma is localized, though full NF1 is more common.
Formerly LEOPARD syndrome, can rarely present with neurofibromas as part of its phenotypic spectrum, though cardiac and other features are more typical.
An allelic variant of NF1 that can present with cafe-au-lait spots and neurofibromas, typically with pulmonary stenosis. Less likely without documented cardiac findings.
